description.narrative: The proposed project will adopt an integrated, holistic and multi-stakeholder approach to improve the resilience, productivity, andsocio-economic conditions of fishing communities as well as the ecological sustainability of the TSBR through community-centred interventions that improve access to safe water and sanitation, enhance education access and quality, and facilitate the development ofsustainable alternative livelihoods.Itwill do so through a series of activitiesto introduce sustainable sanitation and water solutions likeHandy Pods(HPod), Water Kiosk (WK)andeco-waste management services by instituting a low cost payment-based service delivery model run by members ofCFisand wider communities who will be recruited and trained as locally based operators(LBOs).The project will generate demand for sanitation solutions by installing them in schools and selected HHsand engaging communities for uptake and hygiene behavioural change. The project will contribute to universal access to inclusive quality education in the target areas by introducing programs for inclusive education and successful transition; training local teachers; providing direct support to marginalized and at-risk-students; introducing sustainable transportsolutions and rehabilitating schools based on child friendly standards. It will create sustainable livelihoods and employment opportunities in three sub-sectors –eco-tourism, solar energy and sustainable agriculture –through interventions that create sustainable income sources while reducing environmental pressures on the TSBR.A series of actions will be undertaken to create an enabling environment for eco-tourism for both community-led and professional hospitality investments. Members of CFis and wider communities will develop their capacities to enhance production in target food value chains, adopt climate smart agriculture (CSA) and develop business skills. In partnership with the private sector, they will be supported to create community-based sustainable businesses in selected sub-sectors, improving market access through block chain traceability technology and green floating markets. The project will also create employment opportunities in solar energy by supporting community entrepreneurs to installand operate solar micro grids and solar battery recharging stations to provide clean energy for HHs, school transport and community businesses.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project#s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
